1.name: The Sound of Music
1.description: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

2.name: Doctor Zhivago
2.description: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during World War I and then the October Revolution.

3.name: Per qualche dollaro in più
3.description: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a Western outlaw.

4.name: Thunderball
4.description: James Bond heads to the Bahamas to recover two nuclear warheads stolen by SPECTRE agent Emilio Largo in an international extortion scheme.

5.name: Operation Crossbow
5.description: Allied agents attempt to infiltrate the Nazis' rocket research site.

6.name: Repulsion
6.description: A sex-repulsed woman who disapproves of her sister's boyfriend sinks into depression and has horrific visions of rape and violence.

7.name: Cat Ballou
7.description: A young schoolteacher turns into an outlaw to avenge her murdered father.

8.name: In Harm's Way
8.description: A Naval officer, reprimanded after Pearl Harbor, is later promoted to Rear Admiral and gets a second chance to prove himself against the Japanese.

9.name: Battle of the Bulge
9.description: A dramatization of Nazi Germany's final Western Front counterattack of World War II.

10.name: The Great Race
10.description: In the early 20th century, two rivals, the heroic Leslie and the despicable Professor Fate, engage in an epic automobile race from New York to Paris.

11.name: Die, Monster, Die!
11.description: A young man visits his fiancée's estate to discover that her wheelchair-bound scientist father has discovered a meteorite that emits mutating radiation rays that have turned the plants in ...                See full summary »

12.name: Von Ryan's Express
12.description: An American POW leads a group of mainly British prisoners to escape from the Germans in WWII.

13.name: The Greatest Story Ever Told
13.description: An all-star, large scale epic film that chronicles the life and ministry of Jesus Christ.

14.name: The Heroes of Telemark
14.description: Norwegian resistance tries to stop German efforts to produce an atomic bomb component during World War II.

15.name: The Collector
15.description: A man kidnaps a woman and holds her hostage just for the pleasure of having her there.

16.name: Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill!
16.description: Three go-go dancers holding a young girl hostage come across a crippled old man living with his two sons in the desert. After learning he's hiding a sum of cash around, the women start scheming on him.

17.name: Pierrot le fou
17.description: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run.

18.name: Shenandoah
18.description: During the Civil War, a Virginia farmer and his family vow to remain neutral, but one of the sons is captured by Union soldiers, sending the farmer to his rescue.

19.name: Village of the Giants
19.description: Delinquent teen-agers ingest a substance and grow thirty feet tall, then proceed to take over a small town.

20.name: Help!
20.description: Ringo Starr finds himself the human sacrifice target of a cult, and his fellow members of The Beatles must try to protect him from it.

21.name: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold
21.description: British agent Alec Leamas refuses to come in from the Cold War during the 1960s, choosing to face another mission, which may prove to be his final one.

22.name: Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines or How I Flew from London to Paris in 25 hours 11 minutes
22.description: Sabotage efforts damage an international air race.

23.name: Darling
23.description: A beautiful but amoral model sleeps her way to the top of the London fashion scene at the height of the Swinging Sixties.

24.name: The Flight of the Phoenix
24.description: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors says he's an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.

25.name: Rapture
25.description: Agnes, a lonely teenage girl, and her father befriend an escaped convict, named Joseph, who arrives at their farm in Brittany, France. When Joseph develops an attraction to Agnes, her father threatens to break up the union.

26.name: The Sons of Katie Elder
26.description: Ranch owner Katie Elder's four sons determine to avenge the murder of their father and the swindling of their mother.

27.name: The Cincinnati Kid
27.description: An up-and-coming poker player tries to prove himself in a high-stakes match against a long-time master of the game.

28.name: What's New Pussycat
28.description: A playboy who refuses to give up his hedonistic lifestyle to settle down and marry his true love seeks help from a demented psychoanalyst who is having romantic problems of his own.

29.name: Alphaville, une étrange aventure de Lemmy Caution
29.description: A U.S. secret agent is sent to the distant space city of Alphaville where he must find a missing person and free the city from its tyrannical ruler.

30.name: The Ipcress File
30.description: In London, a counter espionage agent deals with his own bureaucracy while investigating the kidnapping and brainwashing of British scientists.

31.name: That Darn Cat!
31.description: After a kidnapped bank teller uses a neighbor's wandering cat to send an SOS, the FBI assigns a cat-allergic agent to the case.

32.name: Major Dundee
32.description: In 1864, due to frequent Apache raids from Mexico into the U.S., a Union officer decides to illegally cross the border and destroy the Apache, using a mixed army of Union troops, Confederate POWs, civilian mercenaries, and scouts.

33.name: Campanadas a medianoche
33.description: The career of Shakespeare's Sir John Falstaff as a roistering companion to young Prince Hal, circa 1400 to 1413.

34.name: A Patch of Blue
34.description: A blind, uneducated white girl is befriended by a black man, who becomes determined to help her escape her impoverished and abusive home life by introducing her to the outside world.

35.name: The Sandpiper
35.description: A free-spirited single mother forms a connection with the wed headmaster of an Episcopal boarding school in California.

36.name: The War Lord
36.description: In 11th century Normandy, a Norman duke sends one of his knights to build a defensive fortress in order to guard the borders against Frisian raiders.

37.name: Akahige
37.description: In 19th century Japan, a rough tempered yet charitable town doctor trains a young intern.

38.name: King Rat
38.description: A fast-taking wheeler-dealer Corporal in a Malaysian P.O.W. camp during World War II uses bribery and larceny to take de facto control of the camp from his senior officers.

39.name: The Hill
39.description: In a North African military prison during World War II, five new prisoners struggle to survive in the face of brutal punishment and sadistic guards.

40.name: Othello
40.description: A General's marriage is destroyed when a vengeful Lieutenant convinces him that his new wife has been unfaithful.

41.name: Ship of Fools
41.description: A varied group of passengers boarding a ship bound for post-war Germany represents a microcosm of 1930s society.

42.name: She
42.description: An Edwardian archaeologist and two companions stumble upon a lost city in East Africa, run by a beautiful queen whose love holds the promise of immortality.

43.name: La decima vittima
43.description: Some people like violence so much, that they decide to create a club in which human hunts are organized - members being alternately hunters, and prey, until they end up dead.

44.name: Kaijû daisensô
44.description: Aliens from Planet X request the use of Godzilla and Rodan to fight off King Ghidorah, but have a better use for the three monsters.

45.name: The Loved One
45.description: Satire on the funeral business, in which a young British poet goes to work at a Hollywood cemetery.

46.name: How to Murder Your Wife
46.description: A dedicated bachelor drunkenly marries a young woman and immediately lives to regret it.

47.name: Ten Little Indians
47.description: Ten people are invited to a luxury mountaintop mansion, only to find that an unseen person is killing them one by one. Could one of them be the killer?

48.name: Dr. Terror's House of Horrors
48.description: Aboard a British train, mysterious fortune teller Dr. Schreck uses tarot cards to read the futures of five fellow passengers.

49.name: Covek nije tica
49.description: A love romance between older, respectable engineer that came in the industrial town to do some expert job and young hairdresser in whose house he stayed in and the consequences of that ...                See full summary »

50.name: Genghis Khan
50.description: During the 13th century the shy Mongol boy Temujin becomes the fearless leader Genghis Khan who unites all Mongol tribes and conquers most of Asia, Europe and the Middle-East.
